SENT.plain: A case with arteriovenous malformation (AVM) associated with moyamoya phenomenon is reported
The 44 year-old female patient was presented with headache and vomiting
Computed tomography (CT) scan showed intraventricular hemorrhage
Cerebral angiography showed right frontal AVM and severe stenosis of right internal carotid artery
The AVM was fed by typical moyamoya vessels, Heubner's artery, and external carotid artery (ECA)
We tried to embolize a bleeding point, compartment attached to lateral ventricle, but we could not
So, we embolized feeders from ECA and sent the patient to radiosurgery
We discuss here treatment and etiology of such rare condition
